name: 2017 Mezam DevFest and Firebase AppFest(by GDG Bamenda and Bambili)
description:
2017 Mezam DevFest and Firebase AppFest Event is three days GDG closter events jointly organized by Google Developer Groups in the North West Region of Cameroon(Bamenda and Bambili). The events cover multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Machine Learning, Mobile Web and other.

As an attendee, you can expect speaker sessions, codelabs, and more.

24 hours hackathon on Firebase will follow where apps hosted shall be evaluated and winners can earn $1000. 

Also visit the event url here: 

https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/102744942792583044503/events/ch0of9beqvqv4lsjhtqpiedpk04

name: GDG Bamenda Web Technologies/Programming Training/Workshops for All.
description:
• What we'll do
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript(including frameworks and Library), Python and PHP.

• What to bring
laptops, notebooks and pens, electric distributors, personal internet modems etc

• Important to know

name: GDG Bamenda Study Jams 2018
description:
• What we'll do
Introduction to Android and Google Cloud Platform
A two days training/workshop on Native Android Development using the Android Studio IDE and on Google Cloud Platform. Android Development training cover XML and some basics of Java Programming and how to put them together to form a full App. Google Cloud Platform training will introduce you into part of cloud computing where you can build and deploy your Java, Python, PHP or Go Apps directly on the the Google Cloud Platform.
• What to bring
Water, pen, notebook, laptops and if possible internet connectivity

• Important to know

name: GDG Bamenda IWD Event: CREATING A NEW HORIZON
description: 2018 International Women's Day event brings together women from all fields of works especially those who are passionate about learning, creating, sharing and impacting their community through Google technology and APIs. It will include Grace Hopper ted talks , Web development , PWA, E_commerce and many exciting activities .﻿

name: Google I/O Extended by GDG Bamenda
